articles.title: Secure Packages with Code Artifact
articles.description: A hands-ob lab that involves setting up AWS CodeArtifact as a centralized, secure package repository for a Java application on EC2, covering domain/repository creation, IAM role-based authentication, Maven configuration, and dependency caching to improve build security and reliability.

articles.title: Small Office LAN Network Simulation with Active Directory (Part 1: Splunk Server)
articles.description: A home lab simulating a virtual office network with Active Directory and Splunk, in order to simulate and detect brute-force attacks and adversary techniques using Kali Linux and Atomic Red Team.

articles.title: Small Office LAN Network Simulation with Active Directory (Part 2: Group Policy Objects and Shared Resources)
articles.description: A home lab simulating a scalable virtual office network with Active Directory Group Policy Objects.

articles.title: Access S3 from a VPC
articles.description: A hands-on lab to building a secure AWS VPC architecture that connects an EC2 instance to Amazon S3, covering networking fundamentals, authentication methods (access keys vs IAM roles), and AWS CLI operations for cloud storage interaction.

articles.title: Create S3 Buckets with Terraform
articles.description: A hands-on lab to building a secure AWS VPC architecture that connects an EC2 instance to Amazon S3, covering networking fundamentals, authentication methods (access keys vs IAM roles), and AWS CLI operations for cloud storage interaction.

articles.title: Setting Up Git and GitHub on AWS EC2
articles.description: A hands-on lab demonstrating how to set up Git on an AWS EC2 instance running Amazon Linux, connect it to a GitHub repository using Personal Access Tokens for authentication, and implement the fundamental version control workflow of staging, committing, and pushing code changes to a remote repository.
